conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graph for Car A to determine if the direction of acceleration changed.
The graph for Car A consists of two identical arcs.
The first arc represents the initial acceleration phase.
The second arc represents the deceleration phase.
The first arc starts at the origin (0 m/s) and increases to a maximum velocity of 2 m/s.
The second arc starts at the maximum velocity of 2 m/s and decreases to 0 m/s.
The first arc indicates an increase in velocity.
The second arc indicates a decrease in velocity.
Within the time interval of 0 to 4 seconds, the direction of Car A's acceleration changed from increasing to decreasing.
